Name: Jar with Handles and Greek Inscriptions
Description: This tall storage jar has a wide neck, flared lip, and rounded base. It has two small handles from below the lip to the shoulder. The body of this jar is undecorated, except at the shoulder where a short Greek text is written in red, perhaps to identify the contents of the jar. The body is obviously wheel-made but the roughness and the polish of the handles suggest that they are hand-made.
